info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 8:50PM EDT until July 14 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...Portions of central and northern Maryland, including the following counties, in central Maryland, Anne Arundel and Howard. In northern Maryland, Baltimore and Baltimore City.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Severn... Pikesville... Middle River... Elkridge... Riviera Beach... Sparrows Point... Back River... Fort Smallwood State Park... Baltimore-Washington Airport... North Point State Park... Millers Island... Glen Burnie... Dundalk... Towson... Catonsville... Essex... Woodlawn... Parkville... Lochearn... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Anne Arundel, MD; Baltimore, MD; Howard, MD; Baltimore City, MD
